snippet: “Al’s Grand Hotel,” a 1971 installation by Allen Ruppersberg that converted a house into a fully functioning hotel and performance space, is being restaged by the Frieze New York art fair.
abstract: Al’s Grand Hotel, 1971 installation by Allen Ruppersberg that converted Los Angeles house into fully functioning hotel and performance space, is being restaged by the Frieze New York art fair; hotel was pioneer in participatory art movement.
lead_paragraph: “Al’s Grand Hotel,” a 1971 installation by Allen Ruppersberg that converted a house into a fully functioning hotel and performance space, is being restaged by the Frieze New York art fair.

headline.main: Grand Hotel Reopens, but Only for 4 Nights
headline.print_headline: Grand Hotel Reopens, but Only for 4 Nights
